column4: hello, everyone.  how do i change the default bash so that vi understand arrow keys, insert, etc?
ubuntu ships with vim-tiny by default which is a bit limited.  I think that's what you are noticing
- vim-full? are you sure that's the package name?
- wierd, i tried to apt-get install vim-full and it just gave me a message about no installation candidate.
probably means you haven't enabled universe
that's the biggest mistake.  I think we all make it until something like this happens, just take it as motivation to have backups from now on
- disk_cache, file_cache, mem_cache... I don't know which one is right for me :T
I have just "cache" too I have no idea what any of them are though
- i'd still like to be able to play some of th newer games.  what do you recommend?
